p: The results showed that both electrodes fabricated from the PAA- g-PEG and PAA binders showed an increase in R SEI after cycles, but the size of the semi-circle was larger for the Si@PAA- g-PEG electrode, which also had a higher R SEI after both 5 cycles and 50 cycles than the Si@PAA (Fig.Â 6e,f). This means that the silicon electrode with the PAA- g-PEG binder, which had the weakest physical stability, formed a thick SEI layer, as it was unable to tolerate the stress caused by volumetric expansion during the charge/discharge process.
